channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gareth Southgate Resigns as England Coach
item.description: Despite losing the final of Euro 2024 to Spain, Southgate’s eight years in charge lifted his country’s men’s team back into the top tier of international soccer.

item.title: North Korean Diplomat Defects to the South, Talks of Execution
item.description: Ri Il-kyu, who fled to South Korea late last year, alleged that two North Korean officials who had been assigned to negotiate with the Trump administration had been punished.

item.title: Tesla is looking to hire 800 new employees 3 months after Elon Musk ordered mass firings of thousands
item.description: The roles have steadily popped up on Tesla’s careers page in recent weeks, with positions spanning artificial intelligence specialists to more run-of-the-mill service jobs.

item.title: J.D. Vance’s Chance
item.description: Why Donald Trump tapped Vance to be his successor.

item.title: Gareth Southgate Resigns as England Coach
item.description: Despite losing the final of Euro 2024 to Spain, Southgate’s eight years in charge lifted his country’s men’s team back into the top tier of international soccer.

item.title: Dublin residents are standing up to $2.3 trillion neighbor Google’s plans to build a pub, saying they are ‘effectively living’ on the tech giant’s campus
item.description: Locals living next to Google's Dublin campus say they will be subjected to public urination if the tech giant is allowed to build a pub.

item.title: Masoud Pezeshkian Promises Change in Iran. Can He Deliver?
item.description: Masoud Pezeshkian, a widowed doctor, portrays himself as a reformer who can bring social and economic shifts. But others have tried and failed before him, and numerous obstacles are in his path.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Surge in West Bank Violence Raises Further Concerns Among Israel’s Allies
item.description: The European Union and the United States have recently imposed new sanctions on settlers and groups that they say have incited violence against Palestinians.

item.title: Uber is betting millions on a startup hoping to solve the biggest roadblock facing electric vehicles
item.description: The ride-share giant is helping fund a startup to make EV charging as easy for renters as for homeowners

item.title: Trump’s Emotional Appearance, and More Republican Convention Takeaways
item.description: Plus, a college football video game breaks new ground.

item.title: J.D. Vance’s Chance
item.description: Why Donald Trump tapped Vance to be his successor.

item.title: Trump’s new VP pick JD Vance brands China the ‘biggest threat’ to the U.S.: ‘We are completely distracted from it’
item.description: JD Vance called China the "biggest threat" in an interview with Fox News shortly after his nomination.

item.title: A Bandaged Trump Shows a Glimpse of Vulnerability
item.description: Donald J. Trump was unusually emotional in his first public appearance since the attempt on his life.

item.title: Heavy Downpours and Flooding Kill Dozens Across South Asia
item.description: Climate change has created more intense monsoon seasons in the region, displacing millions and gutting buildings, bridges and villages.

item.title: Nokia CEO: Europe shouldn’t be afraid to back its innovation champions
item.description: While Europe is still home to world-leading companies, the European Union has fallen behind both the U.S. and China in key technologies.
